content.title: Chin Augmentation Thailand - Bangkok and Samui
h2: WOULD YOU LIKE TO GET SURGEON FEEDBACK?
paragraphs: Have you ever thought about changing or enhancing the appearance of you chin? If you have that means that most likely you’re not happy with the way your chin looks. Well, that’s okay, there’s a simple solution that will give you the chin that will enhance your facial features and give you that boost in self-esteem that you need. All you have to do is consider chin augmentation Thailand, however, before, you begin your quest there are some things that you should know, starting with what chin augmentation is.

Chin augmentation is a procedure in which the whole goal is to reshape or enhance the size of the chin through the method of reshaping the existing bone or by the placement of a prosthetic chin implant. If this sounds like something that you wish to do then chin augmentation Thailandmight be the prefect option for you. The next, thing that you should be concerned with is how the procedure is done.

Chin surgery can take between 30 minutes to an hour to complete. The chin procedure can be preformed either under local anesthesia or general anesthesia, in addition, to sedation. The majority of procedures involve an incision being made inside the mouth on the lower lip or on the skin underneath the chin. The surgeon then will insert the implant through the incision and moves it into place, and then he closes the incision with sutures. For about one week after the surgery, the surgeon may tape the skin with pressure dressing.

There are some reasons why people decide to do chin augmentation Thailand. Some seek chin augmentation to increase or decrease the size of the chin by changing the structure underlying the chin providing a better balance to your facial features. Some may even choose to this procedure to correct an injury or a birth defect. In addition, to this information you also need to be aware of the risk involved.

You never know the what the results of an augmentation will be, however, the complications are rare and are minor. Although, this is the case there are some risk that you should be aware of. The risk can include:

Blood clotsInfectionDisplacement or movement of the implantSwelling and bruisingReaction to the anestheticsThe swelling and the bruising that you’ll experience should last for at least two weeks, but in sometimes the evidence of the swelling and bruising can last for up to two months. However, you can decrease these risk by following what your surgeon tells you. To do after the chin augmentation Thailand.

You’re a good candidate for the augmentation surgery if you have a weak chin, but have a dental bite that is normal. Whatever, the case may be, though, the surgeon will make the final decision as to whether or not you’ll be eligible after you have had an examination and a consolation for the chin augmentation Thailand.
Once you meet all the requirements you’ll be able to have the surgery and have the chin that you desire.

Fill out the Medical Questionnaire (next page) to help our plastic surgeon determine if you are medically qualified for your surgery. Surgeon will carefully review your case and prepare an initial evaluation, including a price quote for procedure(s).
Tell us what you are looking for and we will send you all the information…

( click to enlarge ) Nights in Hospital: 0 Duration of operation is about 1-2 hours and you need to stay in Thailand for at least 7 days.
